artist: Lithographer: J. H. Bufford's Sons, Boston; Printer: Warren Richardson; Composer: Charles Albert White; Publisher: White, Smith, & Perry, Boston
creditline: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Robert D. Semsch
description: Illustrated sheet music cover. Two young children, the orphans of the song, clinging to each other. Behind them are a burning street and a fire engine. The Gothic church in the background is Trinity Church on Summer Street in Boston. which was destroyed in the fire on November 9, 1872.
provenance: Dr. Robert D. Semsch; given to MIA, 1982.
title: Homeless Tonight, or Boston in Ashes
